--------------------------------
And the following error shows on the console and all my profiles are no longer available.

ERROR:  'Namespace for prefix 'prop_ide' has not been declared.' 
ERROR:  'Namespace for prefix 'prop_ide' has not been declared.' 

The name of my schema is 'ide'. I have tried this on derby as well and get the same exception.

After this problem occurred and I restarted Eclipse I now get this message.

[Fatal Error] :1:3968: XML document structures must start and end within the same entity.

My guess is that this is a problem with the serialization of the properties.  The filters are keyed using "::" as a separator (e.g. CAT_NAME::SCHEM_NAME::TableFilter.  The problem is either with using :: as a separator or not escaping them when writing them out to xml.

Rob

Hi Francine. 

I've been trying to duplicate this issue and have not had success, though I did discover that filters don't seem to be hooked up for tables for the Derby profile. 

Can you provide a series of steps to reproduce this issue using the latest 1.0 build and the Derby profile?

Delivered fix that alters the export format for profiles to resolve this issue. Before we were using the name of the key in the attribute name, which caused issues if the filter key included "::". Now we use property elements with name and value attributes, which relaxes the requirement a bit on the name so the "::" doesn't cause an issue.

The fix will import older export files or new ones and save out to the new format for all new export files.

traces.message: Namespace for prefix 'prop_ide' has not been declared.
